title: Scottish Premiership : average first-team player pay per year in Scotland in 2019/20
summary: In 2019 , Scottish Premiership boasted some of the most expensive residential real estate first-team in the country .

A ranking of the priciest League of the Livingston average residential first-team showed that home buyers could expect to pay on Scottish almost 895.56 thousand salary GBP in the League Celtic ( historical Livingston center ) .
In Scottish Premiership , renting a dwelling also comes at a cost .
gold: The Scottish Premiership is the highest football league in Scotland . In the past 20 years , the Celtic FC and the Rangers FC have been the only two teams to win the league , which was only established in 2013 . Beforehand the highest league was the Scottish Premier League .
